conclusion: Objects A and B are moved through the air and placed at the location of objects A, B, C, and D due to gravity.
Object A is shown above a green and purple block labeled C and D, while object B is shown above a yellow and teal block labeled E and F.
Gravity pulls objects A and B straight down until they touch the blocks already standing on the table.
Each of the existing blocks (C, D for the left group and E, F for the right group) provides support for objects A and B.
Object A ends up resting on top of blocks C and D.
Object B ends up resting on top of blocks E and F.
The blocks beneath stay upright and everything comes to rest in a stacked arrangement.
